trans-unit.source: Use Script Action to install Solr on Hadoop cluster | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Use Script Action to install Solr on Hadoop cluster | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Learn how to customize HDInsight cluster with Solr. You'll use a Script Action configuration option to use a script to install Solr.
trans-unit.target: Learn how to customize HDInsight cluster with Solr. You'll use a Script Action configuration option to use a script to install Solr.

trans-unit.source: In this topic, you will learn how to install Solr on Azure HDInsight by using Script Action.
trans-unit.target: In this topic, you will learn how to install Solr on Azure HDInsight by using Script Action.

trans-unit.source: Solr is a powerful search platform and provides enterprise-level search capabilities on data managed by Hadoop.
trans-unit.target: Solr is a powerful search platform and provides enterprise-level search capabilities on data managed by Hadoop.

trans-unit.source: Once you have installed Solr on HDInsight cluster, you'll also learn how to search data by using Solr.
trans-unit.target: Once you have installed Solr on HDInsight cluster, you'll also learn how to search data by using Solr.

trans-unit.source: The steps in this document require a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: The steps in this document require a Linux-based HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: For information on using Solr with a Windows-based cluster, see <linkText>Install and use R on HDinsight Hadoop clusters (Windows)</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For information on using Solr with a Windows-based cluster, see <linkText>Install and use R on HDinsight Hadoop clusters (Windows)</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: The sample script used in this topic creates a Solr cluster with a specific configuration.
trans-unit.target: The sample script used in this topic creates a Solr cluster with a specific configuration.

trans-unit.source: If you want to configure the Solr cluster with different collections, shards, schemas, replicas, etc., you must modify the script and Solr binaries accordingly.
trans-unit.target: If you want to configure the Solr cluster with different collections, shards, schemas, replicas, etc., you must modify the script and Solr binaries accordingly.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Apache Solr</linkText><title></title> is an enterprise search platform that enables powerful full-text search on data.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Apache Solr</linkText><title></title> is an enterprise search platform that enables powerful full-text search on data.

trans-unit.source: While Hadoop enables storing and managing vast amounts of data, Apache Solr provides the search capabilities to quickly retrieve the data.
trans-unit.target: While Hadoop enables storing and managing vast amounts of data, Apache Solr provides the search capabilities to quickly retrieve the data.

trans-unit.source: This topic provides instructions on how to customize an HDInsight cluster to install Solr.
trans-unit.target: This topic provides instructions on how to customize an HDInsight cluster to install Solr.

trans-unit.source: This script makes the following changes to the HDInsight cluster:
trans-unit.target: This script makes the following changes to the HDInsight cluster:

trans-unit.source: Installs Solr into /usr/hdp/current/solr
trans-unit.target: Installs Solr into /usr/hdp/current/solr

trans-unit.source: Creates a new user, solrusr, which is used to run the Solr service
trans-unit.target: Creates a new user, solrusr, which is used to run the Solr service

trans-unit.source: Sets solruser as the owner of /usr/hdp/current/solr
trans-unit.target: Sets solruser as the owner of /usr/hdp/current/solr

trans-unit.source: Adds an <linkText>Upstart</linkText><title></title> configuration that will start Solr if a cluster node restarts.
trans-unit.target: Adds an <linkText>Upstart</linkText><title></title> configuration that will start Solr if a cluster node restarts.

trans-unit.source: Solr is also automatically started on the cluster nodes after installation
trans-unit.target: Solr is also automatically started on the cluster nodes after installation

trans-unit.source: A sample script to install Solr on an HDInsight cluster is available from a read-only Azure storage blob at <linkText>https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxsolrconfigactionv01/solr-installer-v01.sh</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: A sample script to install Solr on an HDInsight cluster is available from a read-only Azure storage blob at <linkText>https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxsolrconfigactionv01/solr-installer-v01.sh</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: This section provides instructions on how to use the sample script while provisioning the cluster by using the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: This section provides instructions on how to use the sample script while provisioning the cluster by using the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: You can also use Azure PowerShell or the HDInsight .NET SDK to create a cluster using this script.
trans-unit.target: You can also use Azure PowerShell or the HDInsight .NET SDK to create a cluster using this script.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using these methods, see <linkText>Customize HDInsight clusters with Script Actions</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on using these methods, see <linkText>Customize HDInsight clusters with Script Actions</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Start provisioning a cluster by using the steps in <linkText>Provision Linux-based HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>, but do not complete provisioning.
trans-unit.target: Start provisioning a cluster by using the steps in <linkText>Provision Linux-based HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>, but do not complete provisioning.

trans-unit.source: On the Optional Configuration blade, select Script Actions, and provide the information below:
trans-unit.target: On the Optional Configuration blade, select Script Actions, and provide the information below:

trans-unit.source: NAME: Enter a friendly name for the script action.
trans-unit.target: NAME: Enter a friendly name for the script action.

trans-unit.source: SCRIPT URI: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxsolrconfigactionv01/solr-installer-v01.sh
trans-unit.target: SCRIPT URI: https://hdiconfigactions.blob.core.windows.net/linuxsolrconfigactionv01/solr-installer-v01.sh

trans-unit.source: HEAD: Check this option
trans-unit.target: HEAD: Check this option

trans-unit.source: WORKER: Check this option
trans-unit.target: WORKER: Check this option

trans-unit.source: ZOOKEEPER: Check this option to install on the Zookeeper node
trans-unit.target: ZOOKEEPER: Check this option to install on the Zookeeper node

trans-unit.source: PARAMETERS: Leave this field blank
trans-unit.target: PARAMETERS: Leave this field blank

trans-unit.source: At the bottom of the Script Actions, use the Select button to save the configuration.
trans-unit.target: At the bottom of the Script Actions, use the Select button to save the configuration.

trans-unit.source: Finally, use the Select button at the bottom of the Optional Configuration blade to save the optional configuration information.
trans-unit.target: Finally, use the Select button at the bottom of the Optional Configuration blade to save the optional configuration information.

trans-unit.source: Continue provisining the cluster as described in <linkText>Provision Linux-based HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: Continue provisining the cluster as described in <linkText>Provision Linux-based HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: You must start with indexing Solr with some data files.
trans-unit.target: You must start with indexing Solr with some data files.

trans-unit.source: You can then use Solr to run search queries on the indexed data.
trans-unit.target: You can then use Solr to run search queries on the indexed data.

trans-unit.source: Use the following steps to add some example data to Solr, and then query it:
trans-unit.target: Use the following steps to add some example data to Solr, and then query it:

trans-unit.source: Connect to the HDInsight cluster using SSH:
trans-unit.target: Connect to the HDInsight cluster using SSH:

trans-unit.source: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see the following:
trans-unit.target: For more information on using SSH with HDInsight, see the following:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Linux, Unix, or OS X</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use SSH with Linux-based Hadoop on HDInsight from Windows</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Steps later in this document make use of an SSL tunnel to connect to the Solr web UI.
trans-unit.target: Steps later in this document make use of an SSL tunnel to connect to the Solr web UI.

trans-unit.source: In order to use these steps, you must establish an SSL tunnel and then configure your browser to use it.
trans-unit.target: In order to use these steps, you must establish an SSL tunnel and then configure your browser to use it.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <linkText>Use SSH Tunneling to access Ambari web UI, ResourceManager, JobHistory, NameNode, Oozie, and other web UI's</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <linkText>Use SSH Tunneling to access Ambari web UI, ResourceManager, JobHistory, NameNode, Oozie, and other web UI's</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Use the following commands to have Solr index sample data:
trans-unit.target: Use the following commands to have Solr index sample data:

trans-unit.source: You'll see the following output on the console:
trans-unit.target: You'll see the following output on the console:

trans-unit.source: The post.jar utility indexes Solr with two sample documents, solr.xml and monitor.xml.
trans-unit.target: The post.jar utility indexes Solr with two sample documents, solr.xml and monitor.xml.

trans-unit.source: These will be stored in collection1 within Solr.
trans-unit.target: These will be stored in collection1 within Solr.

trans-unit.source: Use the following to query the REST API exposed by Solr:
trans-unit.target: Use the following to query the REST API exposed by Solr:

trans-unit.source: This issues a query against collection1 for any documents matching \*:\* (encoded as \%3A\ in the query string,) and that the response should be returned as JSON.
trans-unit.target: This issues a query against collection1 for any documents matching \*:\* (encoded as \%3A\ in the query string,) and that the response should be returned as JSON.

trans-unit.source: The response should appear similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: The response should appear similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: The Solr dashbaord is a web UI that allows you to work with Solr through your web browser.
trans-unit.target: The Solr dashbaord is a web UI that allows you to work with Solr through your web browser.

trans-unit.source: The Solr dashboard is not exposed directly on the Internet from your HDInsight cluster, but must be accessed using an SSH tunnel.
trans-unit.target: The Solr dashboard is not exposed directly on the Internet from your HDInsight cluster, but must be accessed using an SSH tunnel.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using an SSH tunnel, see <linkText>Use SSH Tunneling to access Ambari web UI, ResourceManager, JobHistory, NameNode, Oozie, and other web UI's</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: For more information on using an SSH tunnel, see <linkText>Use SSH Tunneling to access Ambari web UI, ResourceManager, JobHistory, NameNode, Oozie, and other web UI's</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: Once you have established an SSH tunnel, use the following steps to use the Solr dashboard:
trans-unit.target: Once you have established an SSH tunnel, use the following steps to use the Solr dashboard:

trans-unit.source: In your browser, connect to http://headnode0:8983/solr/#/.
trans-unit.target: In your browser, connect to http://headnode0:8983/solr/#/.

trans-unit.source: This traffic should be routed through the SSH tunnel to headnode0 for your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: This traffic should be routed through the SSH tunnel to headnode0 for your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: You should see a page similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: You should see a page similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Image of Solr dashboard</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Image of Solr dashboard</linkText>

trans-unit.source: From the left pane, use the Core Selector drop-down to select collection1.
trans-unit.target: From the left pane, use the Core Selector drop-down to select collection1.

trans-unit.source: Several entries should them appear below collection1.
trans-unit.target: Several entries should them appear below collection1.

trans-unit.source: From the entries below collection1, select Query.
trans-unit.target: From the entries below collection1, select Query.

trans-unit.source: Use the following values to populate the search page:
trans-unit.target: Use the following values to populate the search page:

trans-unit.source: In the q text box, enter \*:\*.
trans-unit.target: In the q text box, enter \*:\*.

trans-unit.source: This will return all the documents that are indexed in Solr.
trans-unit.target: This will return all the documents that are indexed in Solr.

trans-unit.source: If you want to search for a specific string within the documents, you can enter that string here.
trans-unit.target: If you want to search for a specific string within the documents, you can enter that string here.

trans-unit.source: In the wt text box, select the output format.
trans-unit.target: In the wt text box, select the output format.

trans-unit.source: Default is json.
trans-unit.target: Default is json.

trans-unit.source: Finally, select the Execute Query button at the bottom of the search pate.
trans-unit.target: Finally, select the Execute Query button at the bottom of the search pate.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Use Script Action to customize a cluster</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Use Script Action to customize a cluster</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The output returns the two docs that we used for indexing Solr.
trans-unit.target: The output returns the two docs that we used for indexing Solr.

trans-unit.source: The output resembles the following:
trans-unit.target: The output resembles the following:

trans-unit.source: If you need to manually stop or start Solar, use the following commands:
trans-unit.target: If you need to manually stop or start Solar, use the following commands:

trans-unit.source: As a good practice, you should back up the indexed data from the Solr cluster nodes onto Azure Blob storage.
trans-unit.target: As a good practice, you should back up the indexed data from the Solr cluster nodes onto Azure Blob storage.

trans-unit.source: Perform the following steps to do so:
trans-unit.target: Perform the following steps to do so:

trans-unit.source: Connect to the cluster using SSH, then use the following command to create a snapshot of the indexed data:
trans-unit.target: Connect to the cluster using SSH, then use the following command to create a snapshot of the indexed data:

trans-unit.source: You should see a response like this:
trans-unit.target: You should see a response like this:

trans-unit.source: Next, change directories to /usr/hdp/current/solr/example/solr.
trans-unit.target: Next, change directories to /usr/hdp/current/solr/example/solr.

trans-unit.source: There will be a subdirectory here for each collection.
trans-unit.target: There will be a subdirectory here for each collection.

trans-unit.source: Each collection directory contains a data directory, which is where the snapshot for that collection is located.
trans-unit.target: Each collection directory contains a data directory, which is where the snapshot for that collection is located.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you used the steps earlier to index the sample documents, the /usr/hdp/current/solr/example/solr/collection1/data directory should now contain a directory named snapshot.########### where the #'s are the date and time of the snapshot.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you used the steps earlier to index the sample documents, the /usr/hdp/current/solr/example/solr/collection1/data directory should now contain a directory named snapshot.########### where the #'s are the date and time of the snapshot.

trans-unit.source: Create a compressed archive of the snapshot folder using a command similar to the following:
trans-unit.target: Create a compressed archive of the snapshot folder using a command similar to the following:

trans-unit.source: This will create a new archive named snapshot.20150806185338855.tgz, which contains the contents of the snapshot.20150806185338855 directory.
trans-unit.target: This will create a new archive named snapshot.20150806185338855.tgz, which contains the contents of the snapshot.20150806185338855 directory.

trans-unit.source: You can then store the archive to the cluster's primary storage using the following command:
trans-unit.target: You can then store the archive to the cluster's primary storage using the following command:

trans-unit.source: hadoop fs -copyFromLocal snapshot.20150806185338855.tgz /example/data
trans-unit.target: hadoop fs -copyFromLocal snapshot.20150806185338855.tgz /example/data

trans-unit.source: You may want to create a dedicated directory for storing Solr snapshots.
trans-unit.target: You may want to create a dedicated directory for storing Solr snapshots.

trans-unit.source: For example, hadoop fs -mkdir /solrbackup.
trans-unit.target: For example, hadoop fs -mkdir /solrbackup.

trans-unit.source: For more information on working with Solr backup and restores, see <linkText>Making and restoring backups of SolrCores</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on working with Solr backup and restores, see <linkText>Making and restoring backups of SolrCores</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install and use Hue on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install and use Hue on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Hue is a web UI that makes it easy to create, run and save Pig and Hive jobs, as well as browse the default storage for your HDInsight cluster.
trans-unit.target: Hue is a web UI that makes it easy to create, run and save Pig and Hive jobs, as well as browse the default storage for your HDInsight cluster.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters[hdinsight-install-spark]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install and use Spark on HDInsight clusters[hdinsight-install-spark]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Use cluster customization to install Spark on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Use cluster customization to install Spark on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Spark is an open-source parallel processing framework that supports in-memory processing to boost the performance of big-data analytic applications.
trans-unit.target: Spark is an open-source parallel processing framework that supports in-memory processing to boost the performance of big-data analytic applications.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install R on HDInsight clusters[hdinsight-install-r]</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install R on HDInsight clusters[hdinsight-install-r]</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Use cluster customization to install R on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Use cluster customization to install R on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: R is an open-source language and environment for statistical computing.
trans-unit.target: R is an open-source language and environment for statistical computing.

trans-unit.source: It provides hundreds of built-in statistical functions and its own programming language that combines aspects of functional and object-oriented programming.
trans-unit.target: It provides hundreds of built-in statistical functions and its own programming language that combines aspects of functional and object-oriented programming.

trans-unit.source: It also provides extensive graphical capabilities.
trans-unit.target: It also provides extensive graphical capabilities.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install Giraph on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install Giraph on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Use cluster customization to install Giraph on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Use cluster customization to install Giraph on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Giraph allows you to perform graph processing by using Hadoop, and can be used with Azure HDInsight.
trans-unit.target: Giraph allows you to perform graph processing by using Hadoop, and can be used with Azure HDInsight.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Install Hue on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Install Hue on HDInsight clusters</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: Use cluster customization to install Hue on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.
trans-unit.target: Use cluster customization to install Hue on HDInsight Hadoop clusters.

trans-unit.source: Hue is a set of Web applications used to interact with a Hadoop cluster.
trans-unit.target: Hue is a set of Web applications used to interact with a Hadoop cluster.
